what: LSVCMM: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model — LSVCMM-package
title: LSVCMM: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model — LSVCMM-package
text: Implements locally sparse varying coefficient mixed model proposed Fontaine et al. (2023+).

title: LSVCMM: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficients Mixed Model — LSVCMM-package
Prepare control arguments — control_args
text: following arguments supported: max_rounds maximum number rounds coordinate descent (default: 50.) max_iter maximum number iterations per round (default: 1000.) rel_tol relative tolerance convergence (default: 1e-6.) verbose verbosity level. Must 0, 1(default), 2, 3. update_method update method. Must "PGD" "BPGD". Currently overwritten. backtracking_fraction backtracking fraction. Must 0 1 (default: 0.9.) ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored.

title: Prepare family arguments — family_args
text: following arguments supported: response response distribution. Currently, "gaussian" supported. link link function. Currently, "identity" supported. ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored. argument specified, default value used.

title: Generate synthetic data — generate_synthetic_data
code: generate_synthetic_data(   n_subjects = 100,   n_timepoints = 11,   prop_observed = 0.7,   observation_variance = 1,   random_effect_variance_ratio = 1,   random_effect_ar1_correlation = 0.9,   effect_size = 1,   seed = 1 )

title: Generate synthetic data — generate_synthetic_data
text: n_subjects Number subjects (default 100). Half group 0 half group 1 (average). n_timepoints Number time points data sampled spread regularly \([0,1]\) interval (default 11). prop_observed Proportion observed time points (default 0.7). observation_variance Variance observation error (default 1). random_effect_variance_ratio Ratio variance random effect variance observation error (default 1). random_effect_ar1_correlation Correlation two random effects two consecutive timepoints (default 0.9). effect_size Effect size group (default 1). seed Seed random number generator (default 1).

title: Generate synthetic data — generate_synthetic_data
text: list containing following elements: data data frame containing longitudinal data long format. data_wide data frame containing longitudinal data wide format. data_wide_imputed data frame containing longitudinal data wide format imputed missing values. true_values data frame containing true values fixed effects. times vector timepoints data sampled. colnames list containing column names data frames.

title: Generate synthetic data — generate_synthetic_data
text: data generated according following model: $$y_{ij} = \beta_0(t_{ij}) + \beta_1(t_{ij}) g_i + \theta_{ij} + \epsilon_{ij}$$ \(y_{ij}\) response subject \(\) time \(j\) time \((t_{ij})\), \(g_i\) group subject \(\), \(\theta_{ij}\) random effect subject \(\) time \(j\), \(\epsilon_{ij}\) observation error subject \(\) time \(j\), \(\beta_0(\cdot)\) intercept function, \(\beta_1(\cdot)\) effect size. random effects generated according multivariate normal distribution mean 0 covariance matrix \(\Sigma\) \(\Sigma_{ij} = r\sigma^2\rho^{|-j|}\) (\(\rho\) defined random_effect_ar1_correlation \(r\) random_effect_variance_ratio). observation errors generated according multivariate normal distribution mean 0 covariance matrix \(\sigma^2 \) (\(\sigma^2\) defined observation_variance). random effects observation errors independent. response generated according logistic function time group: $$f(t) = \frac{1}{1 + \exp((0.6-t)20)}$$ observations sampled uniformly proportion prop_observed timepoints. imputed version data also provided missing values imputed using function [refund::fpca.sc]. data returned three formats: data data frame containing longitudinal data long format. data_wide data frame containing longitudinal data wide format. data_wide_imputed data frame containing longitudinal data wide format imputed missing values.

title: Prepare kernel arguments — kernel_args
text: following arguments supported: name kernel function. Currently, "gaussian" supported. scale scale parameter. NULL, logarithmic grid search used. n_scale number scale parameters use scale NULL (default.) ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored. grid search, range defined \([L, U]\) \(L\) half smallest gap estimated time points \(U\) twice range estimated time points.

what: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
text: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
code: lsvcmm(   data,   response,   subject,   time,   vc_covariates = NULL,   nvc_covariates = NULL,   offset = NULL,   add_intercept = T,   estimated_time = NULL,   family = DEFAULT_FAMILY_ARGS,   kernel = DEFAULT_KERNEL_ARGS,   penalty = DEFAULT_PENALTY_ARGS,   working_covariance = DEFAULT_WORKING_COVARIANCE_ARGS,   control = DEFAULT_CONTROL_ARGS,   return_models = F )

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
text: data data frame containing variables model. response name response variable data. subject name subject variable data. time name time variable data. vc_covariates names varying coefficient covariates data. nvc_covariates names non-varying coefficient covariates data. offset name offset variable data. add_intercept Whether add intercept model. estimated_time time points estimate varying coefficients. missing, observed time points used. family list arguments response distribution. See family_args. kernel list arguments kernel. See kernel_args. penalty list arguments penalty. See penalty_args. working_covariance list arguments working covariance. See working_covariance_args. control list arguments control parameters. See control_args. return_models Whether return fitted models.

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
text: list containing following elements: family list arguments response distribution. See family_args. kernel list arguments kernel. See kernel_args. penalty list arguments penalty. See penalty_args. working_covariance list arguments working covariance. See working_covariance_args. control list arguments control parameters. See control_args. results data frame containing results optimization. row model resulting particular tuning parameter combination. nvc_path matrix containing estimated non-varying coefficient path dimension (p_u, n_models). vc_path array containing estimated varying coefficient path dimension (p_x, n_timepoints, n_models). scaled_time time points varying coefficients estimated. unscaled_time corresponding values original scale. range_time range time points. models list fitted models.

title: Locally Sparse Varying Coefficient Mixed Models — lsvcmm
text: lsvcmm function fits locally sparse varying coefficient mixed model (LSVCMM) longitudinal data. LSVCMM semiparametric model longitudinal data allows coefficients non-varying covariates vary smoothly time. model defined $$Y_{ij} = \beta_0(t_{ij}) + \sum_{k=1}^p \beta_k(t_{ij}) X_{ijk} + \epsilon_{ij},$$ \(Y_{ij}\) response \(\)-th subject time \(t_{ij}\), \(X_{ijk}\) \(k\)-th non-varying covariate \(\)-th subject time \(t_{ij}\), \(\beta_0(t)\) intercept function, \(\beta_k(t)\) coefficient function \(k\)-th non-varying covariate, \(\epsilon_{ij}\) error term.

title: Prepare penalty arguments — penalty_args
text: following arguments supported: name penalty function. Currently, "adaptive_sparse_group_lasso" supported. alpha mixing parameter. Must 0 1. 1 pure Lasso (default); 0 pure group Lasso. lambda penalty parameter. NULL (default), logarithmic grid search used. n_lambda number penalty parameters use lambda NULL (default.) lambda_factor factor penalty parameter reduced overall (default: 1e-4.) adaptive adaptive parameter. Must non-negative (default: 0..) penalize_intercept Whether penalize intercept. Must TRUE (default) FALSE. ... Additional arguments. Currently ignored. grid search, first obtain minimum \(\lambda_\max\) solution zero. , logarithmically-space sequence \(\lambda\) values generated starting  \(\lambda_\max\) ending \(\lambda_\max \times \texttt{lambda_factor}\).

title: Prepare working covariance arguments — working_covariance_args
text: following arguments supported: name working covariance function. Currently, "compound_symmetry" supported. estimate Whether estimate parameters. Must TRUE (default) FALSE. ratio ratio variance random effects variance error term. negative (default), ratio estimated `log(n)`.
